1. App Switcher: The App Switcher is opened through an apps navigation icon on the
corner of the Global Header.
2. Modal Header: The top section of the App Switcher consists of a modal header which
give the user the option to close the panel by clicking the X icon. This modal header is
also visible on the desktop side panel.
3. Navbar items: The app list shows all available apps within the space the user is
currently working in. Scroll is allowed when a user has access to more apps than what
can fit in the visible space. Maximum number of list items is 10 and the items are sorted
alphabetically.
4. Global list item (sticky): At the bottom of the App Switcher, the user has 2 options.
One enables the user to navigate to the main page of the domain they are logged into.
The other enables the user to see all applications within their domain.
5. Backdrop: A backdrop is a semi-transparent overlay used to indicate that a portion of
the screen is inactive or disabled. It is only used on designs larger than 360px.
Responsive layout
The Ingka Co-worker Design Subsystem uses, spacing, grids and breakpoints standards
from Skapa. Please read here if you are looking for general information about them.
Breakpoint (S)
This variant offers full width and has no backdrop. Recommended for designs between
0 - 599px.

Breakpoint (M-XXL)
This variant provides a backdrop to give visibility to the contents of the page.
Recommended for any designs larger than 600px.

The app list is scrollable and can consist of a up to 10 items, sorted alphabetically. The
global navbar items remain sticky at all times.

Accessibility
Keyboard Interactions
The App Switcher is consisted of links to content. All items can be reached by Tab. By
using Enter key can activate any of the links, this will update the main content area and
put focus back to the top of the page. Activating the X icon (with Enter) on the top right
corner will close the panel, and put focus back to the triggering element, which is the
App Switcher icon in the Global Header.
Q ©) O e ) HH Enter
opens panel
App Switcher panel can be opened by using Enter key on the App Switcher icon in the Global Header.

Links can be reached by Tab, and Enter key is used to activate links. The numbers indicate the order of the keyboard interaction. Dismissing the panel will put back the focus to
the Hamburger Menu icon in the Global Header.
Landmarks
Ingka Co-worker Design applies a navigation landmark around the Hamburger Menu. If
a page includes more than one navigation landmark, each should have a unique label.
This help people who use assistive technology to make a mental model of a screen's
content.

Labelling
The accessibility label for a navigation item is typically the same as the destination
name. If the Ul text is properly linked, assistive technologies like screen readers will
read the Ul text first, followed by the role of the component. In certain cases,
accessibility labels may need additional descriptive text, especially when the visible Ul
text is ambiguous or not visible.
